title: Noob
content: Yup, I'm a noobie at the forum. I need help with a typeface. I am designing a logo for a vintage car repair shop and need a typeface for "Service Station". Been looking all morning, not satisfied. Should I use initial caps or all caps? Any suggestions for a typeface and where I can find it?. Thanks in advance.
author: tbuzbee

comments.content: A script might be nice -- maybe Jukebox Fonts' [Boxer Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019052224/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jukebox/boxer-script-jf/boxer-script-jf/testdrive.html?s=ServiceStation&p=48).
Not to play foundry favorites... Thirstype's [Radio](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019052224/http:/www.thirstype.com/font_radio.html) is nice too.

[www.letterheadfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019052224/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/) for Edsel Ford retro.   
   
 [www.flashfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019052224/http:/www.flashfonts.com/) for James Dean retro.
